div.p: All Elementary School yearbooks will be sold through the Lifetouch Yearbook YBPay site. You will find information about how to place orders in this story. Click on the title.

a.span: Senior Gifts from the HHS PTSA

div.p: Our fabulous Highland High School PTSA has an important message and gift for the Class of 2020. Please read the full story to learn about it and get ordering instructions. #huskystrong #hhsclass2020

div.p: Visit our COVID-19 Updates page at www.highland-k12.org/covid19 for updates

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Updates: Check Frequently for New Info

img.alt: Address panel of a postcard sent in 1957

div.p: This is not the first time that Highland Central School District has been closed for a pandemic and had to turn to “Distance Learning” to keep their students engaged. In 1957, a two-cent stamp and a postcard that did not even need a house number or zip code to get delivered was the distance learning tool. At this time, Cathryn “Kitty” Brault Gruner, Class of 1964, was in Grade 6. Her teacher, Mrs. Langwick, who taught in Highland for over 40 years, wanted to be sure that her students were keeping up with their lessons, so she contacted her students through the mail with a handwritten postcard.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning in 1957: Throwback

div.p: Please read this important message from New York State regarding availability of health insurance.

a.title: Go to comments for NY State of Health

a.span: Updated AP Exam Info as of April 14

div.p: Updates from CollegeBoard about the Spring AP exams keep coming. The situation is fluid and I am sure there are more changes to come. Please check back often for information. Mr. Judge

a.title: Go to comments for Updated AP Exam Info as of April 14
Go to comments for Monday Message

a.span: FRAUD ALERT - USDA Warns of Scams

div.p: (Washington, D.C., March 24, 2020) – Be on the lookout for potential scammers using the COVID-19 situation to steal personal information, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) warned Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) participants today. USDA is issuing this warning after receiving reports of several possible SNAP fraud attempts.

a.title: Go to comments for FRAUD ALERT - USDA Warns of Scams

img.alt: Is your emergency contact information up to date?

a.span: Is your emergency contact information up to date?

div.p: Is your emergency contact information up-to-date? If your child became seriously ill at school, could we reach you? If there were an emergency school closing, how would we let you know? Whether for a snow day, emergency or progress updates school officials occasionally need to contact parents/guardians with important information. We rely on the emergency contact information that you

a.title: Go to comments for Is your emergency contact information up to date?
